content.description:
Long draws recommended to reduce rope drag. All belays spacious and comfy. Great place to learn multi-pitch climbing or to practice advanced techniques in a safer setting.

Pitches 1-3 see Joan of Arc

Pitch 4- Angle up and right over two large steps. Tree Belay. 5.3 30m Often combined with Pitch 5 by staying left of the tree.

Pitch 5- Continue up the main slab. Some route finding required for the next 3 pitches. 5.5 30m

Pitch 6- Continue up the slab and through some bushes. Often combined with Pitch 7. 5.5 30m

Pitch 7- Up the easy slab. 5.3 25m

Pitch 8- Climb up the gully on the right to the base of the corner 5.7. Or Climb the face on the left to the base of the corner 5.8. Then up the groove past a shallow roof to a belay on a boulder at the top. The second to last bolt can be tricky to spot. 5.9 33m

See TAWKROC FB page for some more details:  facebook.com/groups/kootena…


Just before Wapiti Wall, wayyy back in the woods.
bolts and anchors.

Short finger to hand crack. Crux is at the bottom.



30m left and uphill of JOA. Furthest left in a series of cracks. Can be top roped by hiking up the gully.


Single rack up to #2. Bolted anchor with rap rings.

Pitch 1- Either climb right up the blocky corner around the tree to a narrow slab then back left to a good ledge 5.7. Or climb straight up the corner through the broken crack and over some delicate slabs 5.9. 25 - 30m
Pitch 2-  Climb the face then follow the rib up and right to sloping grass ledge. Possible to walk off left. 5.8 25m
Pitch 3- Traverse right then stem your way up the long corner with good holds on the right. 5.9 45m
Exit left and down the trail in the gully or rap the route.

Start at the base of the cliff in a shady belay next to a large rock.
Bolted with fixed anchors

A big slab-o'-rock with long routes and plenty of potential. 
  
 KeTaMux is an Indigenous name which is loosely translated to "warrior princess". First two climbs here have been named accordingly, and the rest should follow suit. 
  
 There is currently 2 routes: Joan of Arc(3 pitches), and Amazons(a 6 pitch extension of Joan of Arc). 
 As well as and closed project (2018) slab to the left of these routes - leave this area be.
